description: Share earnings reflect a 50 percent stock dividend paid in July.

title: BAIRNCO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Fannie Mae Reverses Loss
description: The Federal National Mortgage Association, the nation's largest purchaser of home loans, said yesterday that it earned $24.9 million, or 37 cents a share, in the third quarter.

title: AUTO SALES SURGE 45% IN PERIOD
description: The nation's six major auto manufacturers opened the 1984 model year on a high note, reporting today that sales in the first 10 days of October rose 45 percent from the same period a year earlier.

title: Cast Iron Architecture
description: Friends of Cast Iron Architecture will conduct ''A Grand Tour of SoHo and TriBeCa'' on Sunday at 2 P.M. The tour, to be held rain or shine, will meet at the park at West Broadway and Chambers Street.

title: Museum Show Finery to Lure New Admirers
description: The small blond boy stared up at the Star of India and a shimmering constellation of sapphires, topazes, emeralds and other rare jewels.

title: UNITED BANK F S B reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
FRIDAY, OCTOBER 14, 1983
description: The Economy

title: CENTRAL SOYA CO reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-Including income of $900,000 from discontinued operations for the quarter and year. c-Including income of $300,000 from discontinued operations. Previously reported amounts have been restated to reflect the classification of the poultry products segment as a discontinued business segment.

title: DAYTON MALLEABLE INC reports earnings for Year to Aug 31
description: b-Including a tax credit of $1,883,000. c-Net loss after a pretax provision of $7.8 million for restructuring operations.

title: INFORMER TESTIFIES WILSON PLOTTED TO MURDER WITNESS
description: An informer testified in Manhattan yesterday that Edwin P. Wilson, a former intelligence agent, had promised to pay him $500,000 to ''arrange the murder'' of a key witness.

title: DR. HENRY BARTON, PHYSICIST, IS DEAD
description: Dr. Henry A. Barton, the first director of the American Institute of Physics and an authority on the development of personnel in the sciences, died of a heart attack Tuesday at his vacation home in Greensboro, Vt. He was 85 years old and lived in Princeton, N.J.

title: Congress; Recesses Provide Chances To Fix Home Fences
description: Senator Rudy Boschwitz was telling the students at Forest Lake High School how much he cared about education, but Bev Long was not impressed. She stepped to the microphone at the back of the auditorium and told the Minnesota Republican that Congress should spend more money on education and less on the military.

title: At the Movies
description: ''IF you take the obvious first,'' said Bonnie Bedelia, ''the thing you'd wonder about is my relationship with cars. I have no relationship with cars. To me, a car is hopefully a safe vehicle that has four doors and a place in the back to put groceries. It's for car-pooling. I'm scared of them. I get in the car in the morning and I think, 'Oh, God, something's going to blow up under the hood.' ''

title: WELL-TRAVELED 'WAY OF HOW' ARRIVES IN BROOKLYN
description: After a recent production of George Coates's performance-art piece ''The Way of How,'' someone had a question. Was the fellow who stood on his head really an opera tenor?

title: Hospital Bond Is Insured
description: A $30.5 million portion of a $35 million revenue refunding bond of Pulaski County, Ark., is the first hospital revenue bond offering to be guaranteed by the Municipal Bond Insurance Association, the insurers announced yesterday.

title: Ford Splits Shares And Raises Payout
description: The Ford Motor Company, citing a favorable outlook in the auto industry, said today that it is raising the quarterly dividend on its common stock by 15 cents, to 45 cents a share.

title: 7 Presidential Candidates Debate Arms Control
description: The seven Democratic candidates for President clashed here tonight in a debate over arms control as Senator John Glenn and former Vice President Walter F. Mondale taunted each other for positions they had taken in the past.

title: Stopping Erosion
description: The Pebble Beach Golf Links, one of three courses used in the annual Bing Crosby pro-amateur tournament, is on California's Monterey Peninsula with much of the course fronting on Carmel Bay. Because of severe storms during the last two winters, several spots on the 17th and 18th holes suffered erosion.

title: GRACE, W R, & CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including a gain of $65.1 million on Chemed restructuring. Year-ago results have been restated for a pooling of interests.

title: POTLATCH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Certain year-ago figures have been reclassified to be consistent with the 1983 presentation.

title: Western Airlines Triples Its Net
description: Western Airlines said it would report that net income for the third quarter had tripled from the $3.4 million, or 21 cents a share, of a year ago. The results were given by Andre Dimitriadis, senior vice president of finance, after a special meeting at which shareholders approved a plan to double authorized shares to 70 million.

title: GULL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
DESIGNCRAFT JEWEL INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-Including tax credits of $172,000 for the quarter and $304,000 for the 6 months. c-Including tax credits of $114,000 for the quarter and $217,000 for the 6 months. Corrected from Wednesday's editions.

title: Paris is Silent About Jets for Iraq
description: The French Government turned aside all questions today about its delivery of warplanes to Iraq after the Iraqi President, Saddam Hussein, said in a news conference in Baghdad that the planes had not been received.

title: A PARCHED LAND, AFRICA DESPERATELY NEEDS FOOD
description: From the windows of planes, on flights covering more than 9,000 miles in the last month, much of the African continent appeared parched and crusty, weakening in the grip of a punishing drought that United Nations experts are saying is possibly the most calamitous ever.

title: American Medical Weighs a Rescue
description: American Medical Buildings Inc. said that, with the help of Goldman, Sachs & Company, it is reviewing a ''number of possibilities'' to help solve the financial problems of its American Network division. Elmo R. Zumwalt Jr., its chairman, said in a letter to shareholders that failure to resolve the problems could ''dictate alternatives including liquidation'' of the division.

title: 7,000 WOMEN MARCH IN MANILA, DEMANDING THAT MARCOS RESIGN
description: About 7,000 women, led by the widow of Benigno S. Aquino Jr., marched through the suburban Manila financial district today calling for the resignation of President Ferdinand E. Marcos.

title: Publishing: U.S. Show Abroad
description: One of the least impressive of the nearly 6,000 exhibits from 77 nations at the Frankfurt Book Fair is the tiny booth that is being shared by the United States Information Agency, the Association of American Publishers and the Association of American University Presses.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY: A RETROSPECTIVE OF KARSH PORTRAITS
description: PORTRAIT styles come and go, but few are as etched in the public mind as that of Yousuf Karsh - better known to the multitudes as Karsh of Ottawa. In a typical Karsh photograph, the sitter's visage emerges from a black background so dense and velvety that it could be poured on a sundae. Cheeks and hair are raked by a light so intense that steam seems to issue from it. The eyes stare straight ahead, intense and serious, fortifying the aura of importance we have come to expect in our public figures. It is an official style of portraiture so well honed, and so controlled, that it suffers from being a stereotype.

title: Kentucky Candidates Debate Labor Proposal
description: A quiet campaign between Kentucky's gubernatorial candidates has heated up in a televised debate, with State Senator Jim Bunning, the former major league pitcher, attacking his opponent, Lieut. Gov. Martha Layne Collins.

title: DUPREE REMAINS OUT OF CONTACT
description: Marcus Dupree was absent from school again today, the fourth day in a row.

title: SOME EVIDENCE LEFT OUT OF RECENT ROSENBERG CASE ACCOUNTS
description: To the Editor:

title: City Panel Splits On Theater Plan
description: An advisory panel appointed by Mayor Koch divided yesterday over how and when to use official landmark designation as a means of saving Broadway theaters threatened by development.

title: FOR A POLICY TO COUNTER SYRIAN EXPANSION
description: To the Editor:

title: NATIONAL STATE BANK, ELIZABETH, NJ reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
BROADWAY
description: THE Elizabeth Theater Group, the venture formed by Elizabeth Taylor and Zev Bufman to produce dramatic classics at the Lunt-Fontanne Theater, is in virtual collapse. Miss Taylor and Mr. Bufman are unable to fill the third and final slot of their three-play subscription series in December with ''Inherit the Wind,'' as announced. According to Mr. Bufman, they could not cast the play. Moreover, the producers were unable to come up with another classic as a replacement. As a result, Mr. Bufman is going to bring the new musical ''Peg,'' which he was already planning to present independently on Broadway this season, into the Lunt-Fontanne, offering it as the third play of the subscription.

title: HOMES RAIDED IN COMPUTER-SNOOPING INQUIRY
description: F.B.I. agents raided the homes of more than a dozen young computer enthusiasts around the country Wednesday in an investigation of unauthorized intrusions into scores of large commercial and Defense Department computers, Federal authorities said yesterday.

title: FEDERAL NATIONAL MORTGAGE ASSN (FNNA) (N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss.

title: FINDING THE BEST IN FALL FOLIAGE
description: THE foliage season is approaching metropolitan New York - a little later and a little more muted than usual because of the long dry summer and an autumn that has been a little warmer than usual.

title: A POLITICAL PURGE MAY HAVE LED TO BURMA SECURITY LAPSES IN BLAST
description: A political purge carried out in May is being cited here as largely responsible for the Burmese security system's failure to prevent the bombing last Sunday that killed 21 people, 17 of them South Koreans.

title: PARKER DRILLING CO reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-Net income.

title: ROOMS IN CITY HALL ARE GIVEN A NEW OLD LOOK
description: A lot of things are being changed at City Hall these days to make sure they stay the same.

title: Johnson to Manage Mets Under a 2-Year Contract
description: Dave Johnson was promoted from the minor leagues and was named the 11th manager of the Mets today with a two-year contract. And, in an unusual move, he promptly hired his predecessor, Frank Howard, as one of his coaches.

title: GLATFELTER, P H, CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
A General Discussion
description: Howard Slusher, the agent representing Mike Haynes, the New England Patriots' holdout cornerback who is looking for a job in the United States Football League, met the Generals' owner, Donald Trump, and held talks with other club officials yesterday, but not, they insisted, to discuss a deal for Haynes. ''Howard represents 119 ball players and we probably got around to 40 of them,'' said the Generals' president, Jimmy Gould, who described the meeting as a ''get-acquainted'' session.

title: MEREDITH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes a gain of $2,101,000, or 22 cents a share, from the sale of radio stations and cable properties.

description: Arnold Winer, with Shaller Rubin Associates since 1969, has been named its president and chief executive officer replacing Milton G. Shaller, who will join Mel Rubin as co-chairman.

description: b-After tax credits of $843,000 for the quarter and $1,444,000 for the 9 months.

title: Space Ants Died Before Takeoff
description: An autopsy by students at two local high schools has found that the nation's first ant astronauts died a month before they were sent into space aboard the shuttle Challenger last June.

title: CUOMO AND MOYNIHAN BACK MONDALE
description: Governor Cuomo and Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan, stepping out in front of an expected parade of top New York Democrats to Walter F. Mondale for the Democratic Presidential nomination, formally gave their endorsement to the former Vice President yesterday.

title: PEPSICO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
'Get Crazy,' Rock
description: IF a few of the characters in ''Get Crazy,'' the hip, good-humored rock-and-roll comedy opening today at Loew's State and other theaters, sound familiar, they certainly should. The action takes place on New Year's Eve at a Fillmore-like theater. The roster of performers is headed by one Reggie Wanker (Malcolm McDowell), a cockney egomaniac with 20 years of superstardom behind him, a socialite wife, a taste for high living, and a drummer (John Densmore of the the Doors) with a decidedly Rolling Stones-like demeanor.

title: REAGAN, AGREEING TO '84 RACE, WILL FILE MONDAY, LAXALT SAYST
description: President Reagan gave his permission today for a re-election committee to be formed on his behalf, according to Senator Paul Laxalt, the Republican Party chairman.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article by The Associated Press in some copies of Metropolitan Report Sept. 30 about the killing of an emotionally disturbed woman misidentified the man who shot her. According to the police, she was killed by a police officer as she attacked members of an Emergency Medical Service unit trying to restrain her.

title: Alfredo Kraus Class
description: Alfredo Kraus, the Metropolitan Opera tenor, will give a free, public master class Sunday at 3 P.M. at the Greenwich House Music School, 46 Barrow Street, near Seventh Avenue. The reservations number is 242-4770.

title: Images of the City: Day and Night
description: Lower Manhattan's skyline has dozens of faces. From an airplane at night it is like a toss of diamonds.

title: Soviet Arctic Flotilla Trapped in Pack Ice
description: Pack ice has trapped 50 Soviet ships in Arctic seas north of Siberia, and 26 of them are completely immobilized and in serious danger, a senior marine official said today.

title: MORTON THIOKOL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
New Message From Koch
description: On Mayor Koch's desk, facing visitors to his City Hall office, there used to be a sign that read: ''If you say you can't do it, then you're right. You can't do it.''

Monier Gets China Pact
description: Monier Ltd. said today that it had secured a contract for the supply and installation of a prestressed concrete pipe-making plant in northeast China. Construction and installation will take two years.

title: Windmill at Fordham
description: When Theobald Dengler was studying at Fordham University one of his class projects was to prepare a grant proposal for research funds. He sought money to test designs for small windmills as an alternate energy source.

title: BRIDGE REPAIRS IN CONNECTICUT WIN APPROVAL
description: The General Assembly adjourned today after approving $42 million in repairs on Connecticut's bridges and highways in the wake of the collapse of a Connecticut Turnpike bridge in Greenwich last June 28.

title: Michigan National
description: The Michigan National Corporation expects to report a profit for the third quarter, despite writing off $23 million for loans of the defunct Penn Square Bank of Oklahoma City, said Kenneth Dilaura, the company's controller. He declined to specify the level of profits, which will be disclosed next week. In last year's third quarter, Michigan National had a loss of $15.1 million.

title: Federal Jury Examines Puerto Rican Slayings
description: A Federal grand jury probe began today in a possible coverup in the police slaying of two men the police said were terrorists.

title: SQUARE D CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
UNITED BANKERS reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Man Believed Killed in Blast
description: One man was presumed dead and another was injured in an explosion and fire today that demolished a gas distribution center. The man believed killed was one of seven employees of the Washington Gas and Light Company who were conducting an annual inspection at a normally unmanned facility where the company draws gas off an interstate pipeline. The cause of the blast was not determined.

description: b-Including a gain of $8.9 million, or 33 cents a share, from he sale of a portion of the company's phosphate reserve.

description: To the Editor:

title: Swiss Wholesale Prices
description: The Swiss wholesale price index rose four-tenths of 1 percent in September after a rise of five-tenths of 1 percent in August, the Department for Industry, Trade and Labor said today. The index, with a 1963 base of 100, stood at 171.5 at the end of September, compared with 170.8 in the previous month. The increase from the period last year was eight-tenths of 1 percent.

description: Brian Boitano of Sunnyvale, Calif., and Tiffany Chin of Toluca Lake, Calif., took early leads after the compulsory figures today at Skate America '83.

description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

Action on Dioxin In Connecticut
description: The Connecticut Department of Environmental Protection today ordered a landfill in Naugatuck to close because tests of ground water had revealed the presence of the most toxic form of dioxin, a suspected cancer-causing chemical.

title: WILLIAM HORNBECK DEAD AT 82
description: William Hornbeck, a film editor who won an Academy Award for his work on ''A Place in the Sun'' in 1951, died of cancer Tuesday at Community Memorial Hospital. He was 82 years old.

title: NBD BANCORP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
THREE HIT OR MISS STORES OPENING IN MANHATTAN
description: The Zayre Corporation's Hit or Miss subsidiary, one of the discount industry's largest apparel retailers, will open its first Manhattan stores next week: two in the Wall Street area and one on upper Broadway.

title: BURR-BROWN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
OPERA: MISS NORMAN AS DIDO
description: JESSYE NORMAN was reported to have been impressive as Cassandra in the opening performances of ''Les Troyens'' at the Metropolitan Opera this season, but Dido is a richer role, and on Wednesday night, when Miss Norman switched parts, she created a Carthaginian Queen who was both regal and vulnerable. It was a subtle and affecting dramatic portrait that made the production's abstract metallic sets and often bizarre costumes seem stark indeed in contrast.

title: BOISE CASCADE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss.

title: U.S. Rule to Require Third Auto Brake Light
description: Passenger automobiles produced after Sept. 1, 1985, for sale in the United States will have to have a third brake light mounted at the rear of the car at drivers' eye level, Transportation Secretary Elizabeth Hanford Dole said today.

title: ISIDORE ZIMMERMAN, 66, MAN UNJUSTLY JAILED FOR A MURDER
description: Isidore Zimmerman, who spent nine months on death row and 24 years in New York State prisons for a 1937 murder he did not commit, died of a heart attack Wednesday, four months after winning $1 million from the state for his unjust imprisonment.

title: WRITERS IMPART SKILLS AND STYLES AT WESLEYAN
description: Without raising her voice, Annie Dillard dictated the rules of writing.

title: Bradley Avoids Officials' Dispute
description: Sen. Bill Bradley, Democrat from New Jersey, concerned about becoming involved in a labor dispute between National Basketball Association referees and the league, today asked the Knicks to postpone ceremonies to honor him Oct. 29 at their home opener. The Knicks agreed.

title: Key Rates
description: Salomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: FLORIDA FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss.

title: FACTIONS IN LEBANON DISCUSS CONFERENCE ON RECONCILIATION
description: After nearly three weeks of intensive contacts, representatives of the Lebanese Government and Lebanon's warring factions met for six hours here today to prepare for a Conference of National Reconciliation scheduled for next Thursday. But three of the invited Lebanese Christian and Moslem leaders did not send delegates.

title: FLIGHT ATTENDANTS' BOARD FROWNS ON EASTERN PACT
description: The executive board of the flight attendants' union at Eastern Airlines voted today to send a tentative contract settlement to the rank and file of the 5,800-member union with a recommendation that they reject it.

title: AAV COMPANIES reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-After a loss of $34,304 for the quarter and a gain of $221,816 for the 6 months from discontinued operations. Year-ago results have been restated to reflect discontinuation of vending food service and wholesale distribution segments.

title: Opera: 'Mice and Men'
description: THE New York City Opera has never been afraid to put its money on modern American works. Its continuing effort in that regard is not to be undervalued, no matter what the record of success or failure. Last night the company gave another fairly recent opera an opportunity to shine by introducing New York to Carlisle Floyd's 13-year- old verismo drama, ''Of Mice and Men.''

title: Two Prisoners Escape From a Jail in Queens
description: Two inmates with histories of violent crimes and parole violations escaped early yesterday from the Queensboro State Correctional Facility in Long Island City, Queens, authorities said.

title: Jersey Cites Said to Lag in Aid for the Homeless
description: Virtually all of the emergency shelter beds for homeless adults and children in New Jersey are filled, and local officials are hampering voluntary efforts to increase the number of shelters, an advocacy group charged in a report yesterday.

title: Chemical Net Rises By 10.3%
description: The Chemical New York Corporation, the nation's sixth-largest bank holding company, said yesterday that net income in the third quarter increased 10.3 percent, to $76.3 million, from $69.2 million in the same period last year.

title: Festival with An African-Latin Beat
description: ''ART, in the African tradition, is something that enhances your life, your thinking process, your being,'' said Marta Moreno Vega, executive director of the Caribbean Cultural Center. ''It also influences your community. It's not something that's on a pedestal, or something foreign, or something that you go to on Sundays in a museum. The notion of art for art's sake is not real in terms of our tradition - art should be an immediate extension of your life.''

title: Boston College Gets a Vacation
description: Last Saturday, Boston College scored its fifth victory in six football games this season, 42-7 over Yale. Boston College seemed in fine form, gaining 505 yards with Doug Flutie passing for 325 yards and 4 touchdowns.

Brady Says He Will Quit

David Cort, Author, Is Dead; Former Foreign Editor at Life
description: David Cort, an author, magazine columnist and foreign news editor at Life magazine, died Tuesday in New York Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived in New York.

description: The Hoover Company said it had made a $29.8 million bid for the shares it does not currently own in Hoover P.L.C., a British maker of washing machines and vacuum cleaners.

title: Your Money; Changes in '83 Tax Forms
description: THE 1983 income tax forms that the Federal Government will send out around the end of the year have been changed in a number of important ways. And although most taxpayers will probably not file their returns until close to the April 16, 1984, deadline, they might find it helpful for planning purposes to be aware of the changes as early as possible.

title: ORIOLES TOP PHILS PN ERROR IN 7TH AND TAKE 2-1 LEAD
description: Steve Carlton, who has won four Cy Young Awards, started and lost. Jim Palmer, who has won three Cy Young Awards, relieved and won. And Pete Rose watched from the bench.

title: G.M. Planning A Job Cutback
description: The General Motors Corporation announced that about 1,350 hourly and salaried workers will lose their jobs by late summer next year when engine production at Chevrolet's Flint manufacturing complex is halted.

title: Mother Guilty in Slaying Of 2 Sons for Insurance
description: A jury of nine men and three women has convicted a mother of burning her two young sons to death to collect $10,000 in insurance.

description: Luchino Visconti's ''Ludwig,'' a 1972 film about the last King of Bavaria, will be seen for the first time in the United States in its full-length, Italian-language version on Nov. 3 at the Museum of Modern Art.

title: Inflation Rate Rises in Britain
description: Britain's annual inflation rate rose to 5.1 percent in September, up from 4.6 percent in August and the highest level in seven months, the Government reported today.

title: 150 INMATES ORDERED TRANSFERRED FROM CITY TO A STAE PRISON ON L.I.
description: A Federal judge yesterday ordered that 150 state prisoners in New York City jails be sent to the state's prison in Brentwood, L.I., which Governor Cuomo has pleged to close eventually.

description: The wife of Richard Biegenwald was sentenced today to two years' probation for hindering her husband's arrest on murder charges and for theft of controlled dangerous substances.

description: LAURA Z. A Life. By Laura Z. Hobson. A Strong Woman Illustrated. 410 pages. Arbor House. $17.95.

title: STUDY ADVISES REJECTION OF NERVE GAS FUNDS
description: Congress should reject a Defense Department request for $151.6 million to produce two new nerve gas weapons because of design problems and doubts about a development site, a Congressional study has concluded.

description: More than a week after two senior football players were expelled from Pace University, the controversy surrounding their dismissal has sparked a debate here among some students and administrators regarding, among other things, the point at which a student's private affairs become university matters.

description: Stock prices finished with minor changes yesterday in moderate trading, with International Business Machines, the market's bellwether stock, one of the bigger losers.

description: Prince Norodom Sihanouk, the leader of the anti-Vietnamese Cambodian coalition, said today that there was a ''slim chance'' of working out a political solution to the conflict in Cambodia.

description: Foreign Minister Wu Xueqian of China has ended three days of talks here that American officials said had produced progress in restoring official cultural exchanges and in laying the groundwork for high technology exports to China.

description: Iowa, New Hampshire and Maine, determined to preserve their status as the early states in the Presidential campaign season, served notice today to a key panel of the Democratic National Committee that state laws made it difficult for them to abide by party rules on the timing of their elections.

title: Deficit Spending, Reagan-Style
description: The national debt was pushing $950 billion on the day President Reagan took office. Today it is $1.4 trillion , and he'd have you believe it's all the Democrats' fault. He's wrong.

title: GERMANS IN PROTEST AT U.S. BASES
description: Thousands of demonstrators, protesting the scheduled deployment of American medium-range nuclear missiles in West Germany, conducted sitdown protests today at the gates of several United States military bases.
